intro: Anacampseros tarnensis, commonly known as the Tarn rock cactus, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees Mountains. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and ability to store water. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
